title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. II, subch. B, pt. 142 - MISCELLANEOUS INDUSTRIES AND OCCUPATIONS
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. II, subch. B, pt. 142 - MISCELLANEOUS INDUSTRIES AND OCCUPATIONS
State Regulations

Subpart 142-1 - COVERAGE (§ 142-1.1 to 142-1.15)

Subpart 142-2 - PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO ALL EMPLOYEES SUBJECT TO THIS PART, EXCEPT EMPLOYEES IN NONPROFITMAKING INSTITUTIONS COVERED BY THE PROVISIONS OF SUBPART 142-3 (§ 142-2.1 to 142-2.5)

Subpart 142-3 - PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO EMPLOYEES IN NONPROFITMAKING INSTITUTIONS WHICH HAVE NOT ELECTED TO BE EXEMPT FROM COVERAGE UNDER A MINIMUM WAGE ORDER
Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. II, subch. B, pt. 142

Statutory authority: Labor Law, art. 2, § 21[11], art. 19, §§ 652,673[1]
The amended version of this part by

New

York State Register December 27, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 52, eff. 1/1/2024
is not yet
available. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
